page.title: 05Forestry in Thornton
page.content: The{Forestry Commission,}which was set up in 1919, is responsible for an area of 20,000 hectares organised into 5 blocks, Dalby, Cropton, Wykeham, Hambleton and Cleveland. There are about 2000{trees}in each hectare.These include pine, spruce, fir, oak and beech.The timber is used in the mining industry,for fencing and for paper pulp. The forest{animals}range from grey squirrels, roe-deer,hares, rabbits to newts. The Forestry Commission keeps a careful watch on numbers. {Visitors}to the area enjoy fishing, walking,horse-riding (for those with a permit ), picnics and driving through Dalby.
